Photo via Unsplash

This week in Genesis, Genesis 2.5 beta release, two new theme previews and Genesis revealed as #1 among WordPress themes!

Genesis 2.5 Beta

Six months after the Genesis 2.4 release, StudioPress have released the beta version of Genesis 2.5.

In the words of lead developer Nathan Rice:

2.5 is a big release. There’s a lot to love about it, from new filters and helper functions, to more plugin compatibility, an expanded layout engine, full support for the new WordPress title tag feature, and accessibility improvements.

Plus there’s a lot of improvements that the developers amongst us will appreciate.

For the full list of changes and improvements check out the blog post or download the Genesis Beta Tester plugin.

Genesis 2.5 Beta Released — https://t.co/7rpMurWkRI #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/N5oo56blDe

— StudioPress (@studiopress) March 31, 2017

Themes

Frank over at WP Studio shares a preview of the new portfolio theme he’s working on.

First shots of an upcoming portfolio theme I'm working on. https://t.co/ouWowcTVtT #genesiswp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) March 31, 2017

Matt Whiteley is working on a new theme called Workout Pro.

WorkoutPro development is underway! This #genesiswp Child Theme is fitness based and integrates #acf for simple site management. pic.twitter.com/2BWjs5ELWY

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) March 27, 2017

Showcase

Mike Hemberger with a clean new site for ouraring.com

I’m (we’re) proud to launch the coolest and best looking website I’ve every built. https://t.co/IjKaKpOcbR #genesiswp #wordpress

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) March 31, 2017

Lisa League shares a deep dive into a new Genesis / WooCommerce, qpractice.com

Fun #WooCommerce project on #genesiswp You have to see the turtle 🙂 Great stuff from @Jtsternberg @JS_Zao and team https://t.co/n64PEoo1FT

— Lisa League, NCIDQ (@agirlandaMac) March 28, 2017

Best of the rest

Rafal Tomal shares the story behind the recent redesign of StudioPress.com.

New blog post: Making of: StudioPress Redesign https://t.co/jg8ScolrdE #genesiswp @StudioPress

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) March 30, 2017

Great spot from Sean Jackson over on Built With which shows that the Genesis Framework is holding the #1 spot on the top sites on its index.

Looks like #genesiswp from #StudioPress is powering 11.3% of WordPress Sites … #1ThemeFrameworkhttps://t.co/R6LU9ekCRN pic.twitter.com/fVFnGUGSuV

— Sean Jackson (@seanthinks) March 30, 2017

In case you missed them, BobWP has a run through of the recent compatibility improvements between Genesis and WooCommerce.

Have you noticed this? StudioPress Genesis Child Themes Updates Improve Compatibility with WooCommerce https://t.co/MY5ow8UXsB #genesiswp

— BobWP (@bobWP) March 31, 2017

Widgets SO Genesis, is a new plugin which provides additional widgets when using the SiteOrigin page builder and Genesis.

New plugin which provides additional widgets when using the SiteOrigin page builder and Genesis https://t.co/Sa2W8rctcx pic.twitter.com/g0Rlam0gOd

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) March 27, 2017

Susan Ramsey shows you how to add a nav widget to your Genesis website.

New in my #Genesis4Beginners series: How to add a Nav Widget to your #GenesisWP site. https://t.co/3j9FL6jla2#blogging #WordPress pic.twitter.com/hTuxGQbtMM

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) March 26, 2017
